pr_title: Quickslot Override UI
pr_body: Associated PRs * https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/40 * https://github.com/Terasology/Inventory/pull/24 # Tasks - [x] Move quickslot to the right - [x] Align the slots horizontally - [x] set the selected slot a size wider # Result The quickslot gets Overriden. ## Changes * The whole quickslot moved to the right * Vertical placement of boxes * Orientation is bottom to top ### Issues * Mouse scroll needs to be inverted * Items within flow layout need to stick to the right side of the layout, so the selected, wider, box sticks out from the left part of the column, not the right ## Test UI screenshot

pr_title: Quickslot Override UI
pr_body: Associated PRs * https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/40 * https://github.com/Terasology/Inventory/pull/24 # Tasks - [x] Move quickslot to the right - [x] Align the slots horizontally - [x] set the selected slot a size wider # Result The quickslot gets Overriden. ## Changes * The whole quickslot moved to the right * Vertical placement of boxes * Orientation is bottom to top ### Issues * Mouse scroll needs to be inverted * Items within flow layout need to stick to the right side of the layout, so the selected, wider, box sticks out from the left part of the column, not the right ## Test UI screenshot

pr_title: feat: allow to rotate items in the InventoryHud
pr_body: Associated PR: https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/123 # Result Quickslot item selection changes completely. The active item is now stable, while the inventory items at the quickslot rotate within it in a ring-like style. ![las-inventory](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1448874/87979434-5965ad00-cad2-11ea-8119-5bc026663320.gif) ## Changes The main head behind the changes is @skaldarnar, who gave me the steps on how to implement this method. * Added the boolean variable `rotateItems` to set which quickslot version you want * Added the class `TargetSlotBinding` which provides the above result If you want the correct format and order of the inventory items, please run the test alongside https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/123. ### Shortcut file Not sure this file was created automatically, or by mistake from me. I committed it in case it was automatically created, so to prevent failed tests. ## How to test * Start a game within Terasology (both new or old save is fine) * Fill up your quickslot with at least 2 items * Scroll up and down ## Test UI screenshot __Left image:__ selected item A at the bottom __Right image:__ quickslot after scrolling once downwards; previously selected item A went at the top, and the selected item became the one which was above the previously selected item A. **Note: Below format is done by https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/123. If you run tests without that PR, the selected inventory item would be the top inventory item from quickslot, and the scrolling rotation will be inverted.**

pr_title: feat(FlowLayout): add option for vertical spacing
pr_body:
### Contains

#### Summary

Enhancement of FlowLayout: the option to put vertical spacing in between the items included withing that FlowLayout.

#### Additions

Added a variable named `verticalSpacing`, which can be set within the UI file that used a `FlowLayout`. I used `RowLayout.java`'s implementation of `horizontalSpacing`.

### How to test

#### Steps

1. Get an up-to-date version of the LightAndShadow module
2. Go to file `LightAndShadow/overrides/Inventory/ui/hud/inventoryHud.ui`
3. Find where the `"flowLayout"` is located at, and add the line `"verticalSpacing": 10,` _(or any number instead of `10`)_. Place the line somewhere between lines with `"type"` and `"contents"`, e.g. like this:
```JSON
"type": "flowLayout",
"id": "toolbar",
"verticalSpacing": 10,
"contents": [
```
4. Run your build and create/open a LaS game
5. Notice the spacing between the quickslot slots

#### Result

There should be spacing in between the slots, like the image below:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/87860035-a61a7e00-c942-11ea-8992-5d32c06f1530.png)

### Outstanding before merging

**Q:** Should I add the feature to add horizontal spacing as well, considering it is probably done similarly? If yes, should this PR be merged, and then make a new one for the other new feature?

[{'comment_id': 456820055, 'comment_body': 'This adds a height offset after each element, but I think this should only happen in case there is a "wrap", i.e., inside the conditional above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 18, 19, 25, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456820135, 'comment_body': 'I think the vertical spacing should be added here, instead:
```suggestion
                heightOffset += filledHeight;
                heightOffset += verticalSpacing;
```

This part of the code resets the filled width and height after increasing the height offset, e.g., after wrapping the line.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 18, 19, 26, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456821076, 'comment_body': "oh indeed, I'll look into adding it only when there is a wrap, and then make a commit for it!", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 18, 19, 38, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456821373, 'comment_body': "I see I see, that seems like it, yes. Placed it in that position at the very start (because the other `filledHeight` was there, not because I had the wrapping in mind), but among my other changes till I reach the correct solution I changed it. I'll commit the suggestion üëç", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 18, 19, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457150349, 'comment_body': "Good point - that's something I missed before üëç 

I think you can only multiply with the number of elements in the content if you can make sure that there is only one element per row. However, if you make the flow are bigger, you should see that there might be multiple widgets in the same row before the automatic wrapping kicks in.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 20, 7, 58, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 457161573, 'comment_body': "Indeed, this is a similar note with the one for adding the spacing in the first place, should have thought about that. pr_title: feat(FlowLayout): Add option for horizontal spacing
pr_body:
### Contains

#### Summary

Enhancement of FlowLayout: the option to put vertical spacing in between the items included withing that FlowLayout. 

#### Additions

Added a variable named `horizontalSpacing`, which can be set within the UI file that used a `FlowLayout`. Using #4089 's `verticalSpacing` as reference.

### How to test

#### Steps

1. Search for `inventoryHud.ui` file within the `Inventory` module
2. Place right below the `"id": "toolbar",` the line `"horizontalSpacing": 30,`
3. Find the line `"use-content-width": true,` at the `layoutInfo"` of the `"FlowLayout"` element (line 56) and replace it with `"width": 150,`
4. Run a game of any module that uses the quickslot module (if you use a module that overrides the above file, then make the above changes there. You can check if a file gets overridden if there is a file with this path: `modules/YourModule/overrides/inventory/ui/hud/inventoryHud.ui)
5. Notice the quickslot

#### Result

##### Issues

- [X] Add spacing
- [ ] ~~Remove spacing from the last element of each row~~ - not an error
- [x] Bring the hidden part of the lowest row back inside the screen
- [x] Quickslot is not stuck at its position formating

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/87983012-583b7c80-cae0-11ea-9e19-19273b911272.png)

pr_title: Ammo slot issue fixed, and name change of method used
pr_body: ## Summary ### Result * When opening a save file of a Light And Shadow game in which the last selected item was a bow, the Quiver inventory slot is visible. ### Original Issue * Under the above circumstances, the quiver inventory slot was not visible. Instead, it became visible when you scrolled twice, deselecting and selecting again the bow. ## Contents ### Changes * The method which modifies the slot's visibility was only received through scrolling, thus adding `CharacterComponent.class` within the `@ReceiveEvent`. I guessed that this method has to run within the start-up of the save file, as it represented information for the user's character. * Changed the method's name from `onLauncherSelected` to `onAmmoBearingItemSelected`, as Cervator suggested. This name is more accurate, according to the method's actions. ## How to test * Create a LightAndShadow game * Check 1: see if ammo inventory slot is visible Continue testing by: * Closing terasology * Opening the save file you created * Check 2: see if ammo inventory slot is visible I mention "Check 1", because even if he issue did not occur when -creating- a game, it did have an issue if the order of `haracterComponent.class` and `CharacterHeldItemComponent.class` within: ```Java @ReceiveEvent(components = {CharacterComponent.class, CharacterHeldItemComponent.class}) ``` then the ammo inventory slot didn't appear at all, even with scrolling. ## Screenshot I marked with red: * At the left: the bow that you should have preselected at the inventory * At the right: the ammo slot that you should see if it is visible when the bow is selected
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 449757347, 'comment_body': 'This looks like it\'s a left-over from trying to use `OnAddedComponent` instead of `OnChangedComponent` :thinking: \r\nPlease use the IntelliJ "Optimize Imports" feature by pressing Ctrl+Alt+O to clean up unused imports.\r\nFYI: You can also "optimize code" (formatting) by pressing Ctrl+Alt+L.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 4, 9, 36, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jdrueckert', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 449762021, 'comment_body': 'Indeed. It went under my radar, thanks for pointing it out. I made a new commit removing the extra imports through the key combo you mentioned üëç', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 4, 10, 44, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 453222575, 'comment_body': 'guess that can be removed?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 11, 18, 39, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jdrueckert', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 453226595, 'comment_body': "Oh! Yes it is. Meant to delete it, didn't notice it!", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 11, 19, 27, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: feat: Score hud rework
pr_body:
## Tasks left

- [x] Place the element correctly in the middle of the screen
- [x] Add more spacing between the team name and the score
- [x] text shadows for the team names and scores - WIP https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/52
- [x] use the heart icon color as the font color for the "Hearts" team name - WIP https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/52

## Purpose

This PR will hold commits regarding tasks from issue **Score HUD Element Overhaul https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/issues/131**.

## Additions included so far

- Added a UIImage in between the scores of the two teams _(ToDo: set new asset when that is committed at LASR)_
- Added team images left and right of the element 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88401179-11949d80-cdd2-11ea-8fff-3c4e3c504d83.png)

- Added UILabels next to the current team scores, and 
- Connected the above UILabels with `GOAL_SCORE` at `LASUtils.java`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88442123-f9e20700-ce1b-11ea-8b36-efba76b045e6.png)

- Added new asset, and set layout according to it - asset at https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/47
- Removed "Score" text from the UILabels
- Move "Red" UILabel right before the heart symbol at the right end of the element

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88442490-63aee080-ce1d-11ea-81a2-bc5808421f35.png)

- Set equal `width`s for `Black` and `Red` UILabels
- Changed UILabels `Black` to `Spades` and `Red` to `Hearts
- Added more spacing between the team name and the score
- Placed the element correctly in the middle of the screen

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88485844-e81a7400-cf81-11ea-9e32-59d6f59a70b7.png)

## How to test

1. get LASR latest version
2. start a LAS game
3. notice the Score Element at the middle top part of the screen

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88485857-0bddba00-cf82-11ea-8a7f-259f6d7a5766.png)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 460063454, 'comment_body': 'When replacing the lines about `width` and `height` with
```JSON
"use-content-width": true,
"use-content-height": true,
```
the whole HUD element moves to the left, despite the `"position-horizontal-center": {},`, which is kind of confusing ü§î ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 13, 48, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460064775, 'comment_body': "My first guess is that this probably has to do with the outside `relativeLayout` not having `layoutInfo`, but I haven't looked too much into it yet.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 13, 50, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460268990, 'comment_body': 'I am not sure if this is the best solution to go about. It does work, and currently, we do not have an option to change the max amount of points needed in-game, so binding the `UILabel`s with the `GOAL_SCORE` variable is not _that_ necessary atm in my perspective. I would appreciate any opinions on this.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 20, 19, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460274071, 'comment_body': "Basically the above statement in more detail:
Here I read the two variables (one for Red Team's score and one for Black Team's score) the UILabel that holds the max amount of points you need to score for the game to end, which is set at variable `GOAL_SCORE` within `LASUtils.java`.

What I am doing above, is taking the variable's value directly from `GOAL_SCORE` and giving it to the UILabels, once _(I believe)_ when the Score HUD element is created.

My above comment was about the thought that the above method was not ideal, considering (e.g.) the need for that variable to change sometime in-game - but, I do not think there is any feature that changes that variable in-game, thus no need to use the binding method that the score uses _(see `onScoreUpdateFromServer` in `ClientScoreSystem.java`)_.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 20, 31, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461629951, 'comment_body': "I believe we shouldn't work with whitespaces here but rather with an offset.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 14, 33, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jdrueckert', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461630196, 'comment_body': "> I believe we shouldn't work with whitespaces here but rather with an offset.

Same here.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 14, 34, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jdrueckert', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461632788, 'comment_body': 'One option you could go for here is to implement a kind of "getter" for the goal score, that currently returns the value of the `GOAL_SCORE` constant and can - once this is implemented - return the configured goal score instead. Pinging @skaldarnar for second opinion on this option.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 14, 37, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jdrueckert', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461766891, 'comment_body': 'I think using the constant is a viable first approach here. I just double checked, there is an old `ScoreComponent` which seems to be unused right now. That component could be reused and extended with the target score for winning a game and other configuration. 

That falls into the bucket of cleaning up the package structure of light and shadow and doing a general refactoring/house keeping üôà ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 17, 55, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: feat: Score hud rework
pr_body:
## Tasks left

- [x] Place the element correctly in the middle of the screen
- [x] Add more spacing between the team name and the score
- [x] text shadows for the team names and scores - WIP https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/52
- [x] use the heart icon color as the font color for the "Hearts" team name - WIP https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/52

## Purpose

This PR will hold commits regarding tasks from issue **Score HUD Element Overhaul https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/issues/131**.

## Additions included so far

- Added a UIImage in between the scores of the two teams _(ToDo: set new asset when that is committed at LASR)_
- Added team images left and right of the element 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88401179-11949d80-cdd2-11ea-8fff-3c4e3c504d83.png)

- Added UILabels next to the current team scores, and 
- Connected the above UILabels with `GOAL_SCORE` at `LASUtils.java`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88442123-f9e20700-ce1b-11ea-8b36-efba76b045e6.png)

- Added new asset, and set layout according to it - asset at https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/47
- Removed "Score" text from the UILabels
- Move "Red" UILabel right before the heart symbol at the right end of the element

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88442490-63aee080-ce1d-11ea-81a2-bc5808421f35.png)

- Set equal `width`s for `Black` and `Red` UILabels
- Changed UILabels `Black` to `Spades` and `Red` to `Hearts
- Added more spacing between the team name and the score
- Placed the element correctly in the middle of the screen

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88485844-e81a7400-cf81-11ea-9e32-59d6f59a70b7.png)

## How to test

1. get LASR latest version
2. start a LAS game
3. notice the Score Element at the middle top part of the screen

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/88485857-0bddba00-cf82-11ea-8a7f-259f6d7a5766.png)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 460063454, 'comment_body': 'When replacing the lines about `width` and `height` with
```JSON
"use-content-width": true,
"use-content-height": true,
```
the whole HUD element moves to the left, despite the `"position-horizontal-center": {},`, which is kind of confusing ü§î ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 13, 48, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460064775, 'comment_body': "My first guess is that this probably has to do with the outside `relativeLayout` not having `layoutInfo`, but I haven't looked too much into it yet.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 13, 50, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460268990, 'comment_body': 'I am not sure if this is the best solution to go about. It does work, and currently, we do not have an option to change the max amount of points needed in-game, so binding the `UILabel`s with the `GOAL_SCORE` variable is not _that_ necessary atm in my perspective. I would appreciate any opinions on this.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 20, 19, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460274071, 'comment_body': "Basically the above statement in more detail:
Here I read the two variables (one for Red Team's score and one for Black Team's score) the UILabel that holds the max amount of points you need to score for the game to end, which is set at variable `GOAL_SCORE` within `LASUtils.java`.

What I am doing above, is taking the variable's value directly from `GOAL_SCORE` and giving it to the UILabels, once _(I believe)_ when the Score HUD element is created.

My above comment was about the thought that the above method was not ideal, considering (e.g.) the need for that variable to change sometime in-game - but, I do not think there is any feature that changes that variable in-game, thus no need to use the binding method that the score uses _(see `onScoreUpdateFromServer` in `ClientScoreSystem.java`)_.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 20, 31, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461629951, 'comment_body': "I believe we shouldn't work with whitespaces here but rather with an offset.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 14, 33, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jdrueckert', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461630196, 'comment_body': "> I believe we shouldn't work with whitespaces here but rather with an offset.

Same here.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 14, 34, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jdrueckert', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461632788, 'comment_body': 'One option you could go for here is to implement a kind of "getter" for the goal score, that currently returns the value of the `GOAL_SCORE` constant and can - once this is implemented - return the configured goal score instead. Pinging @skaldarnar for second opinion on this option.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 14, 37, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jdrueckert', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461766891, 'comment_body': 'I think using the constant is a viable first approach here. I just double checked, there is an old `ScoreComponent` which seems to be unused right now. That component could be reused and extended with the target score for winning a game and other configuration. 

That falls into the bucket of cleaning up the package structure of light and shadow and doing a general refactoring/house keeping üôà ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 17, 55, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: feat: re-position dialogue box and response button
pr_body: Part of #132 ## Result The dialog gets Overriden. ## Changes * Box was moved at the bottom left * Answer option was moved right next to the box ### Issues * Text inside the box doesn't go along with the width of the box. E.g.: if box width gets decreased, the text inside gets hidden from the sides. ## How to test 1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/45 2. Start a LaS game 3. Talk to The Fool NPC feature in front of you ## Test UI screenshot

pr_title: feat: re-position dialogue box and response button
pr_body: Part of #132 ## Result The dialog gets Overriden. ## Changes * Box was moved at the bottom left * Answer option was moved right next to the box ### Issues * Text inside the box doesn't go along with the width of the box. E.g.: if box width gets decreased, the text inside gets hidden from the sides. ## How to test 1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/45 2. Start a LaS game 3. Talk to The Fool NPC feature in front of you ## Test UI screenshot

pr_body:
## Purpose

This PR will hold commits regarding tasks from issue Dialogue Screen Overhaul https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/issues/132.

## How to test

1. start new a LAS game
2. talk to the NPC ("The Fool") in front of you
3. the dialogue box will pop up

pr_title: feat: removal of scrillableArea's background
pr_body:
# Merge https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/51 first

## Tasks

- [x] Test how the scroll bar appears when there is more text
- [x] Change text color from white to black - done in #51

## Additions

Removed background behind `scrollableArea`.

### Before

pr_body:
### Tasks
- [x] set ColumnLayout for the UIImages

### Purpose

Set an arrow asset to appear in the appropriate UIImage next to the hoved UIButton.

### How to test

- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/53
- Check https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/pull/15
- Start a LAS game
- Talk to The Fool NPC
- See the image/s next to the answer button/s

_note: the extra response and large text at the dialogue box is not committed and is not planned to be_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90340862-a66e6d80-e003-11ea-9703-096ab73dbb79.png)

pr_title: feat: appear as many UIImages as the UIButton answers
pr_body:
### Tasks
- [x] add UIImages to new column according to prefab file
- [x] set a default asset for the answer button UIImage
- [x] set a custom asset for the answer button UIImage
- [x] create a binding of answer UIImages visibility and hovering over the answers
- [x] add a new column for the UIImages in the Dialogs module (other than the LAS module https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139)
- [x] insert new arrow asset
- [ ] edit answer button's background and font color/shadow - can be done in later PR - WIP https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/pull/18

### Purpose

Set an arrow asset to appear in the appropriate UIImage next to the hovered UIButton.

### How to test

#### For any module other than LightAndShadow (LaS)
- Start a new game of a module other than LaS, which has a dialogue box and provide answers to choose from
- Open the dialogue box within the game
- Hover over the answer(s) and see if the image appears right before the them
- Your result should look like: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90342767-539cb200-e013-11ea-8a30-d9a80ac94d5c.png)

**_note while testing this myself:_** the UIButton flickered sometimes, just a little bit slightly from left to right. Unsure of its causes.

**_concerns:_** I am worried that if some another module Overrides the Dialog box, then there is going to be errors when trying to activate the box within the game.

#### For LAS

- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/53
- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139
- Start a LAS game
- Talk to The Fool NPC
- Hover over the answer(s)
- See the image/s next to the answer button/s like the below screenshot:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90340862-a66e6d80-e003-11ea-9703-096ab73dbb79.png)

#### Appearing when hovering feature
![ezgif-6-bf603de90b64](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90337360-aa41c600-dfea-11ea-997d-388f17cec608.gif)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 462514448, 'comment_body': "This is indeed the right place to add the image. However, I think the image is similar to the text as in that it can (and should) be set from the outside. This method gets the `text` to set as an argument, and I think it should also get the image.

As we want to set the image for the `UIImage` widget it's type should be a `TextureRegion`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 50, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462514727, 'comment_body': 'As you are adding the image widget here you should also make sure to remove it again in the `reset()` method above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 51, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462516629, 'comment_body': "This method is called in [DialogSystem.java#L157](https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/DialogSystem.java#L157), and I think that's the place where to resolve the image to be placed.

This resolution should happen in a way that it is backwards compatible, e.g., if the image is not specified then no image should be shown, and there should be no errors.

We can see that the information about the text comes from the response `r`:

```java
for (DialogResponse r : page.responses) {
   String text = templateEngine.transform(r.text);
   ...
}
```

So we should be looking into how to add the information about the image in the same place.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 54, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462517540, 'comment_body': "The [DialogResponse](https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/components/DialogResponse.java) is actually a simple data container. We could easily add another field there to hold the URN for the response image:

```java
public String responseImage;
```

Then, in `DialogSystem.java`, we'll try to resolve the given string as image URN, get the texture region, and pass it on to `addResponseOption`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 55, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462518591, 'comment_body': 'This could then simply be added to the fool's dialog by adding one line in `MagicFool.prefab`. Obviously, this can be something else than the hearts placeholder icon.

```diff
                 "responses": [
                     {
                         "text": "Very well..",
+                        "responseImage": "LightAndShadowResources:heartsIcon",
                         "action": {
                             "class": "Dialogs:CloseDialogAction"
                         }

```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 57, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462520389, 'comment_body': 'The default screen for dialogs does not have a column layout with this id yet. This should also be added in this PR.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 19, 1, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395522, 'comment_body': "That is pretty interesting! I'll have to look a bit more into how to use the responses, but it does seem like something I can figure out üëç How terasology incorporates URNs is something I need to look more into as well, though I think there are plenty of places I can search to learn more.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395562, 'comment_body': 'About having the image when set through the prefab, and having no image if no image is set at the prefab: what you mean is that if we do not set an image, then the dialogue works exactly like it does now, but if we add the `responseImage`, then a space which equals the width of the `responseImage` is added to the left of each answer button, right? (and when an answer is selected then the image will appear) ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395773, 'comment_body': "oh! wasn't aware of that, I will do so", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464396118, 'comment_body': 'I had placed it here! https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139/files#diff-1e404c9eec7c3fa6cb41356bdb37b0e9R53', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 58, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464448897, 'comment_body': "Yes, either that, or the space is already there but no icon will appear there. @jdrueckert suggested to have a default (hover) image in dialogs to use when no icon is specified, this may be another option.

I'd imagine that the hover image will be scaled to fit the space available in the layout, which means that it might be scaled up or down accordingly. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 14, 27, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464449684, 'comment_body': "Yes, and that's why it is working with Dialogs in LightAndShadow. But what happens in another game mode that does not customize the layout for the dialog window? What happens if the `find(...)` method does not find a `ColumnLayout` with id `responseImage`? ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 14, 28, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464834851, 'comment_body': "Oh! Yes, indeed, I placed it at the override. Then setting it at the original UI file within the dialogue module should solve that issue, right? 
I did also look search a bit to some other files to see it `responseButtons` in case I need to set the new column layout somewhere else too, but it seems there isn't another place to do so. So just the original UI file mentioned should do it.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 4, 6, 47, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464922962, 'comment_body': "@skaldarnar what I want to do here is to set the default image TextureRegion if the user hasn't given an image themself, while when the user has given an image then to set that (String)image as the TextureRegion. My issue is that I can't seem to find (through my research to other files) how a TextureRegion is set, or how you invert a String to TextureRegion.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 4, 9, 30, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: feat: appear as many UIImages as the UIButton answers
pr_body:
### Tasks
- [x] add UIImages to new column according to prefab file
- [x] set a default asset for the answer button UIImage
- [x] set a custom asset for the answer button UIImage
- [x] create a binding of answer UIImages visibility and hovering over the answers
- [x] add a new column for the UIImages in the Dialogs module (other than the LAS module https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139)
- [x] insert new arrow asset
- [ ] edit answer button's background and font color/shadow - can be done in later PR - WIP https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/pull/18

### Purpose

Set an arrow asset to appear in the appropriate UIImage next to the hovered UIButton.

### How to test

#### For any module other than LightAndShadow (LaS)
- Start a new game of a module other than LaS, which has a dialogue box and provide answers to choose from
- Open the dialogue box within the game
- Hover over the answer(s) and see if the image appears right before the them
- Your result should look like: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90342767-539cb200-e013-11ea-8a30-d9a80ac94d5c.png)

**_note while testing this myself:_** the UIButton flickered sometimes, just a little bit slightly from left to right. Unsure of its causes.

**_concerns:_** I am worried that if some another module Overrides the Dialog box, then there is going to be errors when trying to activate the box within the game.

#### For LAS

- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/53
- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139
- Start a LAS game
- Talk to The Fool NPC
- Hover over the answer(s)
- See the image/s next to the answer button/s like the below screenshot:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90340862-a66e6d80-e003-11ea-9703-096ab73dbb79.png)

#### Appearing when hovering feature
![ezgif-6-bf603de90b64](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90337360-aa41c600-dfea-11ea-997d-388f17cec608.gif)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 462514448, 'comment_body': "This is indeed the right place to add the image. However, I think the image is similar to the text as in that it can (and should) be set from the outside. This method gets the `text` to set as an argument, and I think it should also get the image.

As we want to set the image for the `UIImage` widget it's type should be a `TextureRegion`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 50, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462514727, 'comment_body': 'As you are adding the image widget here you should also make sure to remove it again in the `reset()` method above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 51, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462516629, 'comment_body': "This method is called in [DialogSystem.java#L157](https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/DialogSystem.java#L157), and I think that's the place where to resolve the image to be placed.

This resolution should happen in a way that it is backwards compatible, e.g., if the image is not specified then no image should be shown, and there should be no errors.

We can see that the information about the text comes from the response `r`:

```java
for (DialogResponse r : page.responses) {
   String text = templateEngine.transform(r.text);
   ...
}
```

So we should be looking into how to add the information about the image in the same place.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 54, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462517540, 'comment_body': "The [DialogResponse](https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/components/DialogResponse.java) is actually a simple data container. We could easily add another field there to hold the URN for the response image:

```java
public String responseImage;
```

Then, in `DialogSystem.java`, we'll try to resolve the given string as image URN, get the texture region, and pass it on to `addResponseOption`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 55, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462518591, 'comment_body': 'This could then simply be added to the fool's dialog by adding one line in `MagicFool.prefab`. Obviously, this can be something else than the hearts placeholder icon.

```diff
                 "responses": [
                     {
                         "text": "Very well..",
+                        "responseImage": "LightAndShadowResources:heartsIcon",
                         "action": {
                             "class": "Dialogs:CloseDialogAction"
                         }

```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 57, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462520389, 'comment_body': 'The default screen for dialogs does not have a column layout with this id yet. This should also be added in this PR.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 19, 1, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395522, 'comment_body': "That is pretty interesting! I'll have to look a bit more into how to use the responses, but it does seem like something I can figure out üëç How terasology incorporates URNs is something I need to look more into as well, though I think there are plenty of places I can search to learn more.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395562, 'comment_body': 'About having the image when set through the prefab, and having no image if no image is set at the prefab: what you mean is that if we do not set an image, then the dialogue works exactly like it does now, but if we add the `responseImage`, then a space which equals the width of the `responseImage` is added to the left of each answer button, right? (and when an answer is selected then the image will appear) ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395773, 'comment_body': "oh! wasn't aware of that, I will do so", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464396118, 'comment_body': 'I had placed it here! https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139/files#diff-1e404c9eec7c3fa6cb41356bdb37b0e9R53', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 58, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464448897, 'comment_body': "Yes, either that, or the space is already there but no icon will appear there. @jdrueckert suggested to have a default (hover) image in dialogs to use when no icon is specified, this may be another option.

I'd imagine that the hover image will be scaled to fit the space available in the layout, which means that it might be scaled up or down accordingly. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 14, 27, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464449684, 'comment_body': "Yes, and that's why it is working with Dialogs in LightAndShadow. But what happens in another game mode that does not customize the layout for the dialog window? What happens if the `find(...)` method does not find a `ColumnLayout` with id `responseImage`? ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 14, 28, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464834851, 'comment_body': "Oh! Yes, indeed, I placed it at the override. Then setting it at the original UI file within the dialogue module should solve that issue, right? 
I did also look search a bit to some other files to see it `responseButtons` in case I need to set the new column layout somewhere else too, but it seems there isn't another place to do so. So just the original UI file mentioned should do it.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 4, 6, 47, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464922962, 'comment_body': "@skaldarnar what I want to do here is to set the default image TextureRegion if the user hasn't given an image themself, while when the user has given an image then to set that (String)image as the TextureRegion. My issue is that I can't seem to find (through my research to other files) how a TextureRegion is set, or how you invert a String to TextureRegion.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 4, 9, 30, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: feat: appear as many UIImages as the UIButton answers
pr_body:
### Tasks
- [x] add UIImages to new column according to prefab file
- [x] set a default asset for the answer button UIImage
- [x] set a custom asset for the answer button UIImage
- [x] create a binding of answer UIImages visibility and hovering over the answers
- [x] add a new column for the UIImages in the Dialogs module (other than the LAS module https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139)
- [x] insert new arrow asset
- [ ] edit answer button's background and font color/shadow - can be done in later PR - WIP https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/pull/18

### Purpose

Set an arrow asset to appear in the appropriate UIImage next to the hovered UIButton.

### How to test

#### For any module other than LightAndShadow (LaS)
- Start a new game of a module other than LaS, which has a dialogue box and provide answers to choose from
- Open the dialogue box within the game
- Hover over the answer(s) and see if the image appears right before the them
- Your result should look like: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90342767-539cb200-e013-11ea-8a30-d9a80ac94d5c.png)

**_note while testing this myself:_** the UIButton flickered sometimes, just a little bit slightly from left to right. Unsure of its causes.

**_concerns:_** I am worried that if some another module Overrides the Dialog box, then there is going to be errors when trying to activate the box within the game.

#### For LAS

- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/53
- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139
- Start a LAS game
- Talk to The Fool NPC
- Hover over the answer(s)
- See the image/s next to the answer button/s like the below screenshot:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90340862-a66e6d80-e003-11ea-9703-096ab73dbb79.png)

#### Appearing when hovering feature
![ezgif-6-bf603de90b64](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90337360-aa41c600-dfea-11ea-997d-388f17cec608.gif)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 462514448, 'comment_body': "This is indeed the right place to add the image. However, I think the image is similar to the text as in that it can (and should) be set from the outside. This method gets the `text` to set as an argument, and I think it should also get the image.

As we want to set the image for the `UIImage` widget it's type should be a `TextureRegion`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 50, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462514727, 'comment_body': 'As you are adding the image widget here you should also make sure to remove it again in the `reset()` method above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 51, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462516629, 'comment_body': "This method is called in [DialogSystem.java#L157](https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/DialogSystem.java#L157), and I think that's the place where to resolve the image to be placed.

This resolution should happen in a way that it is backwards compatible, e.g., if the image is not specified then no image should be shown, and there should be no errors.

We can see that the information about the text comes from the response `r`:

```java
for (DialogResponse r : page.responses) {
   String text = templateEngine.transform(r.text);
   ...
}
```

So we should be looking into how to add the information about the image in the same place.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 54, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462517540, 'comment_body': "The [DialogResponse](https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/components/DialogResponse.java) is actually a simple data container. We could easily add another field there to hold the URN for the response image:

```java
public String responseImage;
```

Then, in `DialogSystem.java`, we'll try to resolve the given string as image URN, get the texture region, and pass it on to `addResponseOption`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 55, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462518591, 'comment_body': 'This could then simply be added to the fool's dialog by adding one line in `MagicFool.prefab`. Obviously, this can be something else than the hearts placeholder icon.

```diff
                 "responses": [
                     {
                         "text": "Very well..",
+                        "responseImage": "LightAndShadowResources:heartsIcon",
                         "action": {
                             "class": "Dialogs:CloseDialogAction"
                         }

```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 57, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462520389, 'comment_body': 'The default screen for dialogs does not have a column layout with this id yet. This should also be added in this PR.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 19, 1, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395522, 'comment_body': "That is pretty interesting! I'll have to look a bit more into how to use the responses, but it does seem like something I can figure out üëç How terasology incorporates URNs is something I need to look more into as well, though I think there are plenty of places I can search to learn more.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395562, 'comment_body': 'About having the image when set through the prefab, and having no image if no image is set at the prefab: what you mean is that if we do not set an image, then the dialogue works exactly like it does now, but if we add the `responseImage`, then a space which equals the width of the `responseImage` is added to the left of each answer button, right? (and when an answer is selected then the image will appear) ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464395773, 'comment_body': "oh! wasn't aware of that, I will do so", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 57, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464396118, 'comment_body': 'I had placed it here! https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139/files#diff-1e404c9eec7c3fa6cb41356bdb37b0e9R53', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 12, 58, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464448897, 'comment_body': "Yes, either that, or the space is already there but no icon will appear there. @jdrueckert suggested to have a default (hover) image in dialogs to use when no icon is specified, this may be another option.

I'd imagine that the hover image will be scaled to fit the space available in the layout, which means that it might be scaled up or down accordingly. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 14, 27, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464449684, 'comment_body': "Yes, and that's why it is working with Dialogs in LightAndShadow. But what happens in another game mode that does not customize the layout for the dialog window? What happens if the `find(...)` method does not find a `ColumnLayout` with id `responseImage`? ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 3, 14, 28, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464834851, 'comment_body': "Oh! Yes, indeed, I placed it at the override. Then setting it at the original UI file within the dialogue module should solve that issue, right? 
I did also look search a bit to some other files to see it `responseButtons` in case I need to set the new column layout somewhere else too, but it seems there isn't another place to do so. So just the original UI file mentioned should do it.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 4, 6, 47, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 464922962, 'comment_body': "@skaldarnar what I want to do here is to set the default image TextureRegion if the user hasn't given an image themself, while when the user has given an image then to set that (String)image as the TextureRegion. My issue is that I can't seem to find (through my research to other files) how a TextureRegion is set, or how you invert a String to TextureRegion.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 4, 9, 30, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stefaniamak', 'type': 'User'}]

[{'comment_id': 462514448, 'comment_body': "This is indeed the right place to add the image. However, I think the image is similar to the text as in that it can (and should) be set from the outside. This method gets the `text` to set as an argument, and I think it should also get the image.

As we want to set the image for the `UIImage` widget it's type should be a `TextureRegion`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 50, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462514727, 'comment_body': 'As you are adding the image widget here you should also make sure to remove it again in the `reset()` method above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 51, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462516629, 'comment_body': "This method is called in [DialogSystem.java#L157](https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/DialogSystem.java#L157), and I think that's the place where to resolve the image to be placed.

This resolution should happen in a way that it is backwards compatible, e.g., if the image is not specified then no image should be shown, and there should be no errors.

We can see that the information about the text comes from the response `r`:

```java
for (DialogResponse r : page.responses) {
   String text = templateEngine.transform(r.text);
   ...
}
```

So we should be looking into how to add the information about the image in the same place.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 54, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462517540, 'comment_body': "The [DialogResponse](https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/components/DialogResponse.java) is actually a simple data container. We could easily add another field there to hold the URN for the response image:

```java
public String responseImage;
```

Then, in `DialogSystem.java`, we'll try to resolve the given string as image URN, get the texture region, and pass it on to `addResponseOption`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 29, 18, 55, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skaldarnar', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 462518591, 'comment_body': 'This could then simply be added to the fool's dialog by adding one line in `MagicFool.prefab`.                          }

pr_title: feat: appear as many UIImages as the UIButton answers
pr_body:
### Tasks
- [x] add UIImages to new column according to prefab file
- [x] set a default asset for the answer button UIImage
- [x] set a custom asset for the answer button UIImage
- [x] create a binding of answer UIImages visibility and hovering over the answers
- [x] add a new column for the UIImages in the Dialogs module (other than the LAS module https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139)
- [x] insert new arrow asset
- [ ] edit answer button's background and font color/shadow - can be done in later PR - WIP https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/pull/18

### Purpose

Set an arrow asset to appear in the appropriate UIImage next to the hovered UIButton.

### How to test

#### For any module other than LightAndShadow (LaS)
- Start a new game of a module other than LaS, which has a dialogue box and provide answers to choose from
- Open the dialogue box within the game
- Hover over the answer(s) and see if the image appears right before the them
- Your result should look like: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90342767-539cb200-e013-11ea-8a30-d9a80ac94d5c.png)

**_note while testing this myself:_** the UIButton flickered sometimes, just a little bit slightly from left to right. Unsure of its causes.

**_concerns:_** I am worried that if some another module Overrides the Dialog box, then there is going to be errors when trying to activate the box within the game.

#### For LAS

- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/53
- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139
- Start a LAS game
- Talk to The Fool NPC
- Hover over the answer(s)
- See the image/s next to the answer button/s like the below screenshot:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90340862-a66e6d80-e003-11ea-9703-096ab73dbb79.png)

#### Appearing when hovering feature
![ezgif-6-bf603de90b64](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90337360-aa41c600-dfea-11ea-997d-388f17cec608.gif)

pr_title: feat: add responsive image according to hovered UIButton
pr_body:
### Tasks
- [x] set desired max and min size for the column layout holding the UIImages

### Purpose

Set an arrow asset to appear in the appropriate UIImage next to the hoved UIButton.

### How to test

- Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/139
- Check https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/pull/15
- Start a LAS game
- Talk to The Fool NPC
- See the image/s next to the answer button/s

_note: the extra response and large text at the dialogue box is not committed and is not planned to be_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90340862-a66e6d80-e003-11ea-9703-096ab73dbb79.png)
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 462512778, 'comment_body': "I don't think we should work with a background image for the `UIImage` widget here. \r\n\r\nNote that the background image is rendered behind the widget itself (i.e., the background). The `UIImage` widget would render another image on top if properly configured. I think we should rather set the source for the image to render in the widget correctly. pr_title: fix: image's column height
pr_body:
## Associated
This PR fixes the same issue but within LAS: https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/pull/19

## Description

- An issue with Answer Image positioning:
Even if there was no issue in previous tests, this time it seemed that the positioning was off

## Changes

### For Issue
I believe the issue was that I set a `family` with fixed height at the column hosting the answer images, which family was meant to set a fixed size at the answer UIImages. What I did, was to remove the family from the column, and add it via code to each new UIImage added before the answer UIButtons.

### How to test

1. ~~Check https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/pull/18~~
2. Talk to the NPC (The Fool) in front of you when you start the game

pr_title: new answer button assets
pr_body: ## Description - An issue with Answer Image positioning: Even if there was no issue in previous tests, this time it seemed that the positioning was off - Added two new assets about the answer buttons, one as a default image, and one for when hovering/pushing the button. ## Changes ### For Issue I believe the issue was that I set a `family` with fixed height at the column hosting the answer images, which family was meant to set a fixed size at the answer UIImages. What I did, was to remove the family from the column, and add it via code to each new UIImage added before the answer UIButtons. ### For background images #### New Assets - default one - hover/push #### Results Because the UIButtons match the width of their column, which matches the width of the wider button (the one with the most text in it), the image seems kind of weird to the buttons with less text. The solution should be to set at each UIButtons the LayoutInfo of `"use-content-width": true`, but I am not aware of how to do that via code yet. ### How to test 1. Start a game which contains a Dialogue box 2. Trigger the dialogue box If you want to test this with LightAndShadow: 1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/156 2. Talk to the NPC (The Fool) in front of you when you start the game

pr_title: feat: game over screen skin rework
pr_body:
## Purpose

This PR is about modifications according to the design of the Game Over Screen.

## Changes made

* Added a `family` part at the elements within the UI file at the 

## How to test

1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/146
2. Start a LAS game
3. Choose a team
4. Open the developer tab and gain the enemy team's by writting `give` and `redflag` or `blackflag`
5. Score as many points as you need to finish up the game
6. The Game Over Screen will pop up when you score the last point

_Note:_ You can go to `LAUtils.java` and change `GOAL_SCORE` variable from `5` to `1`, so you need to score 1 point to end the game.

## Current Version

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90937107-49adf100-e40f-11ea-89f3-5b9c4ab1d87c.png)

pr_title: feat: game over screen skin rework
pr_body:
## Purpose

This PR is about modifications according to the design of the Game Over Screen.

## Changes made

* Added a `family` part at the elements within the UI file at the 

## How to test

1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/146
2. Start a LAS game
3. Choose a team
4. Open the developer tab and gain the enemy team's by writting `give` and `redflag` or `blackflag`
5. Score as many points as you need to finish up the game
6. The Game Over Screen will pop up when you score the last point

_Note:_ You can go to `LAUtils.java` and change `GOAL_SCORE` variable from `5` to `1`, so you need to score 1 point to end the game.

## Current Version

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90937107-49adf100-e40f-11ea-89f3-5b9c4ab1d87c.png)

pr_title: feat: game over screen skin rework
pr_body:
## Purpose

This PR is about modifications according to the design of the Game Over Screen.

## Changes made

* Added a `family` part at the elements within the UI file at the 

## How to test

1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/146
2. Start a LAS game
3. Choose a team
4. Open the developer tab and gain the enemy team's by writting `give` and `redflag` or `blackflag`
5. Score as many points as you need to finish up the game
6. The Game Over Screen will pop up when you score the last point

_Note:_ You can go to `LAUtils.java` and change `GOAL_SCORE` variable from `5` to `1`, so you need to score 1 point to end the game.

## Current Version

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90937107-49adf100-e40f-11ea-89f3-5b9c4ab1d87c.png)

pr_title: feat: game over screen UI rework
pr_body:
## Purpose

This PR is about modifications according to the design of the Game Over Screen.

## Changes made

* Added a `family` part at the elements within the UI file at the 

## How to test

1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/56
2. Start a LAS game
3. Choose a team
4. Open the developer tab and gain the enemy team's by writting `give` and `redflag` or `blackflag`
5. Score as many points as you need to finish up the game
6. The Game Over Screen will pop up when you score the last point

_Note:_ You can go to `LAUtils.java` and change `GOAL_SCORE` variable from `5` to `1`, so you need to score 1 point to end the game.

## Current Version

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/90937107-49adf100-e40f-11ea-89f3-5b9c4ab1d87c.png)

[{'comment_id': 475934606, 'comment_body': 'The only thing I didn't manage to reduce is this code. I tried many things, but non prove effective.

What I am doing here, is filling up the row with empty spaces, so the width of the row is forced to be divided into many little spaces. 

My initial tries revolved around the setting of 1 UISpace, and tried to set the desired widths via code, my tries - which all ended up at having 3 equally divided columns - were:
- Set a "width" at the UISpace
- Set ColumnConstrains at the MigLayout
- Place them in a RowLayout, and tried to modify that
- Use "span 8" at the UISpace to span it 8 cells
- Use "cell [column] [row] [width] [height]" where the "[ ]" contain numbers, the cells were arranged correctly, but the width and height didn't change
- Removed the "dock south" from the second MigLayout (L167) and placed it at the bottom with a width 3 and re-done the above methods, all failed

pr_title: feat: coloring of Victory-Defeat Label
pr_body:
## Purpose
The change of colors to the `gameOverResult` UILabel. When text is "Victory" its color is Blue, when "Defeat" its color is "Red"

## Changes made

Set the wanted colors to the appropriate new `families`.

## How to test

1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/148
2. Start a LAS game
3. Choose a team
4. Open the developer tab and gain the enemy team's by writting `give` and `redflag` or `blackflag`
5. Score as many points as you need to finish up the game
6. The Game Over Screen will pop up when you score the last point

_Note:_ You can go to `LAUtils.java` and change `GOAL_SCORE` variable from `5` to `1`, so you need to score 1 point to end the game.

## Screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/91207308-3c477e00-e711-11ea-9a74-1a34410e4ec5.png)

pr_title: feat: set a family factor at the UILabel
pr_body:
## Purpose
The change of colors to the `gameOverResult` UILabel. When text is "Victory" its color is Blue, when "Defeat" its color is "Red"

## Changes made

I decided to set the variable to a different `Family`, and edit both families at the `skin` file. 

My initial tried were to set the color via code, using as reference the below two methods that his happens:

- https://github.com/Terasology/Dialogs/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/dialogs/DialogSystem.java#L173-L174
``` java
mappings.put("player.name", clientInfo.getComponent(DisplayNameComponent.class).name);
mappings.put("player.color", "0x" + clientInfo.getComponent(ColorComponent.class).color.toHex());
```
- https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/blob/develop/src/main/java/org/terasology/ligthandshadow/componentsystem/controllers/ClientGameOverSystem.java#L111-L112
``` java
migLayout.addWidget(new UILabel(PlayerUtil.getColoredPlayerName(clientComponent.clientInfo)),
                new MigLayout.CCHint());
```
## How to test

1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/57
2. Start a LAS game
3. Choose a team
4. Open the developer tab and gain the enemy team's by writting `give` and `redflag` or `blackflag`
5. Score as many points as you need to finish up the game
6. The Game Over Screen will pop up when you score the last point

_Note:_ You can go to `LAUtils.java` and change `GOAL_SCORE` variable from `5` to `1`, so you need to score 1 point to end the game.

## Screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/91207308-3c477e00-e711-11ea-9a74-1a34410e4ec5.png)

pr_title: feat: added outer border to the game over screen
pr_body:
## Purpose
I added a border (color green) at the outside of the wider UIBox.

## Changes made
I change the outer UIBox's and outer RelativeLayout's `family`s. The RelativeLayout got the `family` with the white background and the UIBox got the `family` with the green background.

## How to test

1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadowResources/pull/58
2. Start a LAS game
3. Choose a team
4. Open the developer tab and gain the enemy team's by writting `give` and `redflag` or `blackflag`
5. Score as many points as you need to finish up the game
6. The Game Over Screen will pop up when you score the last point

_Note:_ You can go to `LAUtils.java` and change `GOAL_SCORE` variable from `5` to `1`, so you need to score 1 point to end the game.

## Screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/91220697-35c30180-e725-11ea-9a47-51922e24b673.png)

pr_title: feat: removal of unwanted backgrounds after changes
pr_body:
## Purpose
I added a border (color green) at the outside of the wider UIBox.

## Changes made
After changes at https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/149 , I had to remove some backgrounds that were inherited.

## How to test

1. Check https://github.com/Terasology/LightAndShadow/pull/149
2. Start a LAS game
3. Choose a team
4. Open the developer tab and gain the enemy team's by writting `give` and `redflag` or `blackflag`
5. Score as many points as you need to finish up the game
6. The Game Over Screen will pop up when you score the last point

_Note:_ You can go to `LAUtils.java` and change `GOAL_SCORE` variable from `5` to `1`, so you need to score 1 point to end the game.

## Screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48293545/91220697-35c30180-e725-11ea-9a47-51922e24b673.png)
